trans-unit.source: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 4 | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Server 2013 farm Phase 4 | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Create the SharePoint server virtual machines and a new SharePoint farm in Phase 4 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Create the SharePoint server virtual machines and a new SharePoint farm in Phase 4 of the SharePoint Server 2013 farm in Azure.

trans-unit.source: SharePoint Intranet Farm Workload Phase 4: Configure SharePoint servers
trans-unit.target: SharePoint Intranet Farm Workload Phase 4: Configure SharePoint servers

trans-unit.source: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the application and web tiers of the SharePoint farm and create the farm by using the SharePoint Configuration Wizard.
trans-unit.target: In this phase of deploying an intranet-only SharePoint 2013 farm with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure infrastructure services, you build out the application and web tiers of the SharePoint farm and create the farm by using the SharePoint Configuration Wizard.

trans-unit.source: You must complete this phase before moving on to <link><linkText>Phase 5</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You must complete this phase before moving on to <link><linkText>Phase 5</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for all of the phases.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Deploying SharePoint with SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups in Azure</linkText><title></title></link> for all of the phases.

trans-unit.source: Create the SharePoint server virtual machines in Azure
trans-unit.target: Create the SharePoint server virtual machines in Azure

trans-unit.source: There are four SharePoint server virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: There are four SharePoint server virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Two SharePoint server virtual machines are for the front-end web servers, and two are for administration and hosting SharePoint applications.
trans-unit.target: Two SharePoint server virtual machines are for the front-end web servers, and two are for administration and hosting SharePoint applications.

trans-unit.source: Two SharePoint servers in each tier provide high availability.
trans-unit.target: Two SharePoint servers in each tier provide high availability.

trans-unit.source: Use the following block of Azure PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the four SharePoint servers. Specify the values for the variables, removing the < and > characters. Note that this Azure PowerShell command set uses values from the following tables:
trans-unit.target: Use the following block of Azure PowerShell commands to create the virtual machines for the four SharePoint servers. Specify the values for the variables, removing the < and > characters. Note that this Azure PowerShell command set uses values from the following tables:

trans-unit.source: Table M, for your virtual machines
trans-unit.target: Table M, for your virtual machines

trans-unit.source: Table V, for your virtual network settings
trans-unit.target: Table V, for your virtual network settings

trans-unit.source: Table S, for your subnet
trans-unit.target: Table S, for your subnet

trans-unit.source: Table A, for your availability sets
trans-unit.target: Table A, for your availability sets

trans-unit.source: Table C, for your cloud services
trans-unit.target: Table C, for your cloud services

trans-unit.source: Recall that you defined Table M in <link><linkText>Phase 2: Configure domain controllers</linkText><title></title></link> and Tables V, S, A, and C in <link><linkText>Phase 1: Configure Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Recall that you defined Table M in <link><linkText>Phase 2: Configure domain controllers</linkText><title></title></link> and Tables V, S, A, and C in <link><linkText>Phase 1: Configure Azure</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: When you have supplied all the proper values, run the resulting block at the Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link><linkText>Logging on to a virtual machine with a Remote Desktop connection procedure</linkText><title></title></link> four times, once for each SharePoint server, to log on by using the [Domain]\sp_farm_db account credentials.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link><linkText>Logging on to a virtual machine with a Remote Desktop connection procedure</linkText><title></title></link> four times, once for each SharePoint server, to log on by using the [Domain]\sp_farm_db account credentials.

trans-unit.source: You created these credentials in <link><linkText>Phase 2: Configure domain controllers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You created these credentials in <link><linkText>Phase 2: Configure domain controllers</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Use the <link><linkText>To test connectivity procedure</linkText><title></title></link> four times, once for each SharePoint server, to test connectivity to locations on your organization network.
trans-unit.target: Use the <link><linkText>To test connectivity procedure</linkText><title></title></link> four times, once for each SharePoint server, to test connectivity to locations on your organization network.

trans-unit.source: Configure the SharePoint farm
trans-unit.target: Configure the SharePoint farm

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to configure the first SharePoint server in the farm:
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to configure the first SharePoint server in the farm:

trans-unit.source: From the desktop of the first SharePoint application server, double-click SharePoint 2013 Products Configuration Wizard.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop of the first SharePoint application server, double-click SharePoint 2013 Products Configuration Wizard.

trans-unit.source: When you're asked to allow the program to make changes to the computer, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When you're asked to allow the program to make changes to the computer, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: On the Welcome to SharePoint Products page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Welcome to SharePoint Products page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: A SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard dialog appears, warning that services (such as IIS) will be restarted or reset.
trans-unit.target: A SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard dialog appears, warning that services (such as IIS) will be restarted or reset.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes.

trans-unit.source: On the Connect to a server farm page, select Create a new server farm, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Connect to a server farm page, select Create a new server farm, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Configuration Database Settings page:
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Configuration Database Settings page:

trans-unit.source: In Database server, type the name of the primary database server.
trans-unit.target: In Database server, type the name of the primary database server.

trans-unit.source: In Username, type [Domain]\sp_farm_db (created in Phase 2: Configure domain controllers.
trans-unit.target: In Username, type [Domain]\sp_farm_db (created in Phase 2: Configure domain controllers.

trans-unit.source: Recall that the sp_farm_db account has sysadmin privileges on the database server.
trans-unit.target: Recall that the sp_farm_db account has sysadmin privileges on the database server.

trans-unit.source: In Password, type the sp_farm_db account password.
trans-unit.target: In Password, type the sp_farm_db account password.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Farm Security Settings page, type a passphrase twice.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Farm Security Settings page, type a passphrase twice.

trans-unit.source: Record the passphrase and store it in a secure location for future reference.
trans-unit.target: Record the passphrase and store it in a secure location for future reference.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configure SharePoint Central Administration Web Application page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure SharePoint Central Administration Web Application page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: The Completing the SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard page appears.
trans-unit.target: The Completing the SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard page appears.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: The Configuring SharePoint Products page appears.
trans-unit.target: The Configuring SharePoint Products page appears.

trans-unit.source: Wait until the configuration process finishes, about 8 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Wait until the configuration process finishes, about 8 minutes.

trans-unit.source: After the farm is successfully configured, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: After the farm is successfully configured, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: The new administration website starts.
trans-unit.target: The new administration website starts.

trans-unit.source: To start configuring the SharePoint farm, click Start the Wizard.
trans-unit.target: To start configuring the SharePoint farm, click Start the Wizard.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following procedure on the second SharePoint application server and the two front-end web servers:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following procedure on the second SharePoint application server and the two front-end web servers:

trans-unit.source: From the desktop, double-click SharePoint 2013 Products Configuration Wizard.
trans-unit.target: From the desktop, double-click SharePoint 2013 Products Configuration Wizard.

trans-unit.source: When you're asked to allow the program to make changes to the computer, click Yes.
trans-unit.target: When you're asked to allow the program to make changes to the computer, click Yes.

trans-unit.source: On the Welcome to SharePoint Products page, click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Welcome to SharePoint Products page, click Next.

trans-unit.source: A SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard dialog appears, warning that services (such as IIS) will be restarted or reset.
trans-unit.target: A SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard dialog appears, warning that services (such as IIS) will be restarted or reset.

trans-unit.source: Click Yes.
trans-unit.target: Click Yes.

trans-unit.source: On the Connect to a server farm page, click Connect to an existing server farm, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Connect to a server farm page, click Connect to an existing server farm, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Configuration Database Settings page, type the name of the primary database server in Database server, and then click Retrieve Database Names.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Configuration Database Settings page, type the name of the primary database server in Database server, and then click Retrieve Database Names.

trans-unit.source: Click SharePoint_Config in the database name list, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click SharePoint_Config in the database name list, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Specify Farm Security Settings page, type the passphrase from the previous procedure.
trans-unit.target: On the Specify Farm Security Settings page, type the passphrase from the previous procedure.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: The Completing the SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard page appears.
trans-unit.target: The Completing the SharePoint Products Configuration Wizard page appears.

trans-unit.source: Click Next.
trans-unit.target: Click Next.

trans-unit.source: On the Configuration Successful page, click Finish.
trans-unit.target: On the Configuration Successful page, click Finish.

trans-unit.source: When SharePoint creates the farm, it configures a set of server logins on the primary SQL Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: When SharePoint creates the farm, it configures a set of server logins on the primary SQL Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: SQL Server 2012 introduces the concept of users with passwords for contained databases.
trans-unit.target: SQL Server 2012 introduces the concept of users with passwords for contained databases.

trans-unit.source: The database itself stores all the database metadata and user information, and a user who is defined in this database does not need to have a corresponding login.
trans-unit.target: The database itself stores all the database metadata and user information, and a user who is defined in this database does not need to have a corresponding login.

trans-unit.source: The information in this database is replicated by the availability group and is available after a failover.
trans-unit.target: The information in this database is replicated by the availability group and is available after a failover.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Contained databases</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Contained databases</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: However, by default, SharePoint databases are not contained databases.
trans-unit.target: However, by default, SharePoint databases are not contained databases.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, you will need to manually configure the secondary database server so that it has the same set of logins for SharePoint farm accounts as the primary database server.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, you will need to manually configure the secondary database server so that it has the same set of logins for SharePoint farm accounts as the primary database server.

trans-unit.source: You can perform this synchronization from SQL Server Management Studio by connecting to both servers at the same time.
trans-unit.target: You can perform this synchronization from SQL Server Management Studio by connecting to both servers at the same time.

trans-unit.source: After you finish this initial setup, more configuration options for the capabilities of the SharePoint farm are available.
trans-unit.target: After you finish this initial setup, more configuration options for the capabilities of the SharePoint farm are available.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Planning for SharePoint 2013 on Azure infrastructure services</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Planning for SharePoint 2013 on Azure infrastructure services</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure internal load balancing
trans-unit.target: Configure internal load balancing

trans-unit.source: You configure internal load balancing so that client traffic to the SharePoint farm is distributed evenly to the two front-end web servers.
trans-unit.target: You configure internal load balancing so that client traffic to the SharePoint farm is distributed evenly to the two front-end web servers.

trans-unit.source: This requires you to specify an internal load-balancing instance that consists of a name and its own IP address, assigned from the subnet address space.
trans-unit.target: This requires you to specify an internal load-balancing instance that consists of a name and its own IP address, assigned from the subnet address space.

trans-unit.source: To determine whether an IP address that you choose for the internal load balancer is available, use the following Azure PowerShell commands:
trans-unit.target: To determine whether an IP address that you choose for the internal load balancer is available, use the following Azure PowerShell commands:

trans-unit.source: If the IsAvailable field in the display of the Test-AzureStaticVNetIP command is True, you can use the IP address.
trans-unit.target: If the IsAvailable field in the display of the Test-AzureStaticVNetIP command is True, you can use the IP address.

trans-unit.source: From an Azure PowerShell command prompt on your local computer, run the following set of commands:
trans-unit.target: From an Azure PowerShell command prompt on your local computer, run the following set of commands:

trans-unit.source: Next, add a DNS address record to your organization's DNS infrastructure that resolves the fully qualified domain name of the SharePoint farm (such as sp.corp.contoso.com) to the IP address assigned to the internal load balancer instance (the value of $IP in the preceding Azure PowerShell command block).
trans-unit.target: Next, add a DNS address record to your organization's DNS infrastructure that resolves the fully qualified domain name of the SharePoint farm (such as sp.corp.contoso.com) to the IP address assigned to the internal load balancer instance (the value of $IP in the preceding Azure PowerShell command block).

trans-unit.source: This is the configuration that results from the successful completion of this phase:
trans-unit.target: This is the configuration that results from the successful completion of this phase:

trans-unit.source: Next step
trans-unit.target: Next step

trans-unit.source: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <link><linkText>Phase 5: Create the availability group and add the SharePoint databases</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To continue with the configuration of this workload, go to <link><linkText>Phase 5: Create the availability group and add the SharePoint databases</linkText><title></title></link>.
